concept.title: April 13, 2017
concept.shortdesc: Release Notes for the April 13, 2017 release.

row.entry: Fixed a bug so that large files can be uploaded via the "Post to Collection" API.
Fixed a bug that prevented mp4 videos from uploading when using the Upload Media API.
Fixed a bug that caused Library searches with hashtags to intermittently fail.
Fixed a bug in Maps to support a large number of content in clusters on iOS devices.
Fixed a bug to enable new Instagram tasks to stream in effectively in the ModQ.
Fixed a bug to allow users to successfully make changes to Mosaic apps in Designer.
Added a new rights request status called "Request Failed" to highlight when rights request messages fail to send.
Fixed a bug that disabled the ability to invite new Owners and Moderators who didn't have an existing commenting account.
Added the ability for customers to create Spam Moderation Rules in Settings.
Fixed a bug that prevented VK.com posts from displaying via URL Social Searches.
Added a usability enhancement so that pinned Storify 2 posts don't render overlapping pin and close icons when using the "Show Permalinks in Modal" option.
Fixed a bug that caused an "App is not accepting new content" banner to falsely display on top of Stream Rule pages.
Modified the default of newly created stream rules to Apply SAFE Rules when applicable.
Removed the "Vines" only option from Twitter Stream/Curate rules, as Vines are now displayed as Twitter videos.
Fixed a bug that prevented the ability to save new App Title names on various apps in Designer.
Improved the search results when searching by Article ID in App Manager.
Fixed a bug that caused unicode content to not render when viewing more details on an asset in Library.
Updated the look and feel to the Details modal on Mosaic cards.
Added a new configuration in Mosaic Designer so that details on a card can be viewed on click.
Fixed some usability bugs when enabling the alwaysShowEditor parameter on the Reviews app.
Fixed a bug that prevented Storify 2 embeds from rendering when using the requireJS library on the page.
Fixed a bug that prevented rules from being copied over to a new stream when cloning an existing stream.
